DataElement.preferredDefinition: A sub-division of the AECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._A subdivision of adverse event data.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of adverse event data.

Concepts.definition: A subdivision of adverse event data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. AESCAT can only be used if there is an AECAT and it must be a subcategorization of AECAT.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the adverse event subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

DataElement.changeDescription: 6.8.21 Released to support CDISC CDE metrics clean-up. mc 2/18/20 tmt transferred ownership from NRDS to NCI Standards/BMaeske and restored CSIs. 11-26-19 tmt removed NCI CSI, associated with NRDS CSI and changed Registration Status. 11-25-19 tmt transferred ownership from NCI Standards to NRDS/BMaeske. 7/30/18 Created as part of the CDISC mapping task; tt.
